Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Xuanzang on Imperial Order
Chapter 18, Section 7: The Attainment of Nothingness
ÅšÄriputra!

The name of the door of liberation of emptiness is only provisionally established by guests. It does not come from the ten directions or the three times, nor does it go anywhere or abide anywhere. In the door of liberation of emptiness, there is no name, and in the name, there is no door of liberation of emptiness. It is neither combined nor separate, but only provisionally established.
Why is this?

Because the door of liberation of emptiness and the name are both empty of inherent nature. In inherent emptiness, whether it is the door of liberation of emptiness or the name, both are non-existent and cannot be attained.

The names of the doors of liberation of signlessness and wishlessness are only provisionally established by guests. They do not come from the ten directions or the three times, nor do they go anywhere or abide anywhere. In the doors of liberation of signlessness and wishlessness, there are no names, and in the names, there are no doors of liberation of signlessness and wishlessness. They are neither combined nor separate, but only provisionally established.
Why is this?

Because the doors of liberation of signlessness and wishlessness are empty of their own nature, and in the emptiness of inherent nature, the doors of liberation of signlessness and wishlessness and their names are both non-existent and cannot be obtained.

The name of a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is also like this, only provisionally designated. It does not come from the ten directions or the three times, nor does it go anywhere or abide anywhere. Within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is no name, and within the name there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva. It is neither combined nor separate, but only a provisional designation.
Why is this?

Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva and the name are both empty of their own nature, and in the emptiness of inherent nature, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva and the name are both non-existent and cannot be obtained.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva only has a provisional name.
ÅšÄriputra!

Just as the names of the five eyes are only conventionally designated, coming from nowhere in the ten directions and three times, going nowhere, and also not abiding anywhere. Among the five eyes there are no names, and among the names there are no five eyes. They are neither combined nor separate, but are only conventionally established.
Why is this?
Because the five eyes and their names are both empty of intrinsic nature. In the emptiness of intrinsic nature, both the five eyes and their names are non-existent and cannot be obtained.

Just as the names of the six supernormal knowledges are only conventionally designated, coming from nowhere in the ten directions and three times, going nowhere, and also not abiding anywhere. Among the six supernormal knowledges there are no names, and among the names there are no six supernormal knowledges. They are neither combined nor separate, but are only conventionally established.
Why is this?

Because the six supernormal knowledges and their names are both empty of intrinsic nature. In the emptiness of intrinsic nature, both the six supernormal knowledges and their names are non-existent and cannot be obtained.

The name of a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is also like this, only provisionally designated, not coming from the ten directions or the three times, not going anywhere, and also not abiding anywhere. Within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is no name, and within the name there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva. It is neither combined nor separate, but only a provisional designation.
Why is this?

Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva and the name are both empty of inherent nature. Within the emptiness of inherent nature, neither the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva nor the name exist, and both are unobtainable.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva only has a provisional name.
ÅšÄriputra!

The name of the ten powers of a Buddha is only provisionally designated, not coming from the ten directions or the three times, not going anywhere, and also not abiding anywhere. Within the ten powers of a Buddha there is no name, and within the name there are no ten powers of a Buddha. It is neither combined nor separate, but only a provisional designation.
Why is this?

Because the ten powers of a buddha and their names are both empty of intrinsic nature, in the emptiness of intrinsic nature, both the ten powers of a buddha and their names are non-existent and cannot be apprehended.

Just as the names of the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of unobstructed understanding, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity, and the eighteen distinctive abilities of a buddha are only provisionally established as guests, they do not come from the ten directions or the three times, nor do they go anywhere or abide anywhere. The four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of unobstructed understanding, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity, and the eighteen distinctive abilities of a buddha are not within names, and names are not within the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of unobstructed understanding, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity, and the eighteen distinctive abilities of a buddha. They are neither combined nor separate, but are only provisionally established.
Why is it so?

because the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha are all empty of inherent nature, and in the emptiness of inherent nature, the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha, as well as their names, are all non-existent and cannot be apprehended.

The name 'bodhisattva-mahÄsattva' is also like this, only provisionally designated as an 'arriving guest'. It does not come from the ten directions or the three times, nor does it go anywhere or abide anywhere. Within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is no name, and within the name there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva. It is neither combined nor separate, but only a provisional designation.
Why is this?

Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva and its name are both empty of inherent nature. In the emptiness of inherent nature, both the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva and its name are non-existent and cannot be apprehended.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is merely a provisional name.
ÅšÄriputra!

Just as the name of all-knowledge is only provisionally included, it does not come from the ten directions or the three times, it does not go anywhere, and it also does not abide anywhere. Within all-knowledge there is no name, and within the name there is no all-knowledge. It is neither combined nor separate, but is merely provisionally established.
Why is this?
Because all-knowledge and the name are both empty of inherent nature. Within the emptiness of inherent nature, both all-knowledge and the name are both non-existent and unobtainable.

Just as the name of the knowledge of the path and the knowledge of all aspects is only provisionally included, it does not come from the ten directions or the three times, it does not go anywhere, and it also does not abide anywhere. Within the knowledge of the path and the knowledge of all aspects there is no name, and within the name there is no knowledge of the path or the knowledge of all aspects. It is neither combined nor separate, but is merely provisionally established.
Why is this?

Because the cognition of the aspects of the path and the cognition of all aspects are empty of inherent nature together with the name, in the emptiness of inherent nature the cognition of the aspects of the path and the cognition of all aspects, as well as the name, are all non-existent and cannot be apprehended.

The name 'bodhisattva-mahÄsattva' is also like this, only provisionally designated. It does not come from the ten directions and three periods of time, does not go anywhere, and also does not abide anywhere. Within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is no name, and within the name there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva. It is neither combined nor separate, but only a provisional designation.
Why is this?

Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is empty of inherent nature together with the name, in the emptiness of inherent nature the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva and the name are all non-existent and cannot be apprehended.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva only has a provisional name.
ÅšÄriputra!

Just as the name 'absence of forgetfulness' is only provisionally established, coming from nowhere in the ten directions and three times, going nowhere, and also not abiding anywhere, and there is no name within absence of forgetfulness, and no absence of forgetfulness within the name, they are neither conjoined nor disjoined, but only provisionally established.
Why is this?

Because absence of forgetfulness and the name are both empty of their own-nature, and within the emptiness of own-nature, both absence of forgetfulness and the name are non-existent and cannot be apprehended.

Just as the name 'constant abiding in equanimity' is only provisionally established, coming from nowhere in the ten directions and three times, going nowhere, and also not abiding anywhere, and there is no name within constant abiding in equanimity, and no constant abiding in equanimity within the name, they are neither conjoined nor disjoined, but only provisionally established.
Why is this?

Because constant abiding in equanimity and the name are both empty of their own-nature, and within the emptiness of own-nature, both constant abiding in equanimity and the name are non-existent and cannot be apprehended.

The name of a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is also like this, only provisionally designated. In the ten directions and three times, it does not come from anywhere, does not go to anywhere, and also does not abide anywhere. Within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, there is no name, and within the name, there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva. It is neither combined nor separate, but only a provisional designation.
Why is it so?

Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva and the name are both empty of inherent nature. Within the emptiness of inherent nature, both the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva and the name are non-existent and cannot be attained.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason, I say:
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva only has a provisional name.
ÅšÄriputra!

Just as the name of all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways is only provisionally designated, in the ten directions and three times, it does not come from anywhere, does not go to anywhere, and also does not abide anywhere. Within all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways, there is no name, and within the name, there are no all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways. It is neither combined nor separate, but only a provisional designation.
Why is it so?
Because all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways and names are empty of inherent nature. In the emptiness of inherent nature, both all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways and names are non-existent and cannot be obtained.

Just as the name of all samÄdhi gateways is only provisionally established as a guest, it does not come from the ten directions or the three times, does not go anywhere, and also does not abide anywhere. Within all samÄdhi gateways there is no name, and within the name there are no all samÄdhi gateways. They are neither combined nor separate, but are only provisionally established.
Why is it so?
Because all samÄdhi gateways and names are empty of inherent nature. In the emptiness of inherent nature, both all samÄdhi gateways and names are non-existent and cannot be obtained.

The name of a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is also like this, only provisionally designated, neither coming from the ten directions and three periods of time, nor going to or abiding anywhere. Within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is no name, and within the name there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva. It is neither combined nor separate, but only a provisional designation.
Why is it so?

Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva and the name are both empty of inherent nature. In the emptiness of inherent nature, neither the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva nor the name exist, and cannot be apprehended.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason, I say:
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva only has a provisional name.
ÅšÄriputra!

The name of internal emptiness is only provisionally designated, neither coming from the ten directions and three periods of time, nor going to or abiding anywhere. Within internal emptiness there is no name, and within the name there is no internal emptiness. It is neither combined nor separate, but only a provisional designation.
Why is it so?
Because inner emptiness and the name are both empty of intrinsic nature, in the emptiness of intrinsic nature, both inner emptiness and the name are non-existent and cannot be apprehended.

Just as the names 'external emptiness', 'internal and external emptiness', 'emptiness of emptiness', 'great emptiness', 'ultimate emptiness', 'emptiness of the conditioned', 'emptiness of the unconditioned', 'absolute emptiness', 'emptiness without beginning or end', 'emptiness of dispersion', 'emptiness of transformation', 'emptiness of intrinsic nature', 'emptiness of specific characteristics', 'emptiness of common characteristics', 'emptiness of all phenomena', 'emptiness of non-apprehension', 'emptiness of intrinsic nature', 'emptiness of intrinsic nature of non-existence', and 'emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence of intrinsic nature' are only provisional designations, they do not come from the ten directions or the three times, they do not go anywhere, and they do not abide anywhere. In external emptiness up to the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence of intrinsic nature, there are no names, and in the names there is no external emptiness up to the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence of intrinsic nature. They are neither conjoined nor disjoined, but are only provisionally established.
Why is it so?

Because external emptiness up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence and names are both empty of inherent nature, in inherent emptiness, external emptiness up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence and names are both non-existent and cannot be obtained.

The name 'bodhisattva-mahÄsattva' is also like this, only provisionally designated, it does not come from the ten directions and three periods of time, it does not go anywhere, and it also does not abide anywhere. Within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is no name, and within the name there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva. It is neither combined nor separate, but only provisionally established.
Why is this?
Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva and the name are both empty of inherent nature, in inherent emptiness, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva and the name are both non-existent and cannot be obtained.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason, I say:
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva only has a provisional name.
ÅšÄriputra!

Just as the name 'suchness' is only a guest, it comes from nowhere in the ten directions and three times, goes nowhere, and also does not abide anywhere. In suchness there is no name, and in the name there is no suchness. It is neither combined nor separate, but only provisionally established.
Why is this?
Because suchness and name are both empty of inherent nature. In the emptiness of inherent nature, both suchness and name are non-existent and cannot be obtained.

The dharma realm, dharma nature, non-false nature, unchanging nature, inconceivable realm, space realm, realm of cessation, realm of separation, realm of extinction, equality, nature of separation from birth, dharma determination, abiding in the dharma, natureless realm, signless realm, formless realm, unconditioned realm, peaceful realm, tranquil realm, original non-existence, ultimate reality, and final nirvana are all included in mere names. They come from nowhere in the ten directions and three times, go nowhere, and also do not abide anywhere. In the dharma realm up to final nirvana, there are no names, and in names there is no dharma realm up to final nirvana. They are neither combined nor separate, but are merely provisionally established.
Why is this?

Because the dharma realm up to final nirvana and names are both empty of their own nature. In the emptiness of their own nature, both the dharma realm up to final nirvana and names are non-existent and cannot be obtained.

The name of a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is also like this, only provisionally designated, neither coming from the ten directions and three periods of time, nor going to or abiding anywhere. Within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is no name, and within the name there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva. It is neither combined nor separate, but only a provisional designation.
Why is this?

Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva and the name are both empty of inherent nature. Within the emptiness of inherent nature, neither the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva nor the name exist, and cannot be apprehended.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason, I say:
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva only has a provisional name.
ÅšÄriputra!

Just as the name 'stage of extreme joy' is only provisionally designated, neither coming from the ten directions and three periods of time, nor going to or abiding anywhere, within the stage of extreme joy there is no name, and within the name there is no stage of extreme joy. It is neither combined nor separate, but only a provisional designation.
Why is this?
Because the ground of joy and its name are both empty of intrinsic nature, in the emptiness of intrinsic nature, neither the ground of joy nor its name exist.

Just as the ground of freedom from defilements, the ground of luminous wisdom, the ground of blazing wisdom, the ground of difficult to conquer, the ground of manifest wisdom, the ground of far-reaching, the ground of immovable, the ground of excellent wisdom, and the ground of cloud of Dharma are only provisional designations, they do not come from the ten directions or the three times, they do not go anywhere, and they do not abide anywhere. The ground of freedom from defilements up to the ground of cloud of Dharma have no names, and in names there are no grounds of freedom from defilements up to the ground of cloud of Dharma. They are neither combined nor separate, but are only provisionally established.
Why is this?

Because the ground of freedom from defilements up to the ground of cloud of Dharma and their names are both empty of intrinsic nature, in the emptiness of intrinsic nature, neither the ground of freedom from defilements up to the ground of cloud of Dharma nor their names exist.

The name of a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is also like this, only provisionally designated, neither coming from the ten directions and three periods of time, nor going anywhere, nor abiding anywhere. Within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is no name, and within the name there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva. It is neither combined nor separate, but only a provisional designation.
Why is this?

Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva and the name are both empty of inherent nature. In the emptiness of inherent nature, neither the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva nor the name exist, and cannot be apprehended.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva only has a provisional name.
ÅšÄriputra!

Like the name of the stage of different kinds of soil is only provisionally designated, neither coming from the ten directions and three periods of time, nor going anywhere, nor abiding anywhere. Within the stage of different kinds of soil there is no name, and within the name there is no stage of different kinds of soil. It is neither combined nor separate, but only a provisional designation.
Why is this?

Because the stage of different kinds of beings and names are both empty of intrinsic nature, in the emptiness of intrinsic nature, the stage of different kinds of beings and names are both non-existent and cannot be apprehended.

Just as the stage of lineage, the eighth stage, the stage of complete seeing, the stage of thin [afflictions], the stage of separation from desires, the stage of accomplishment, the pratyekabuddha stage, the bodhisattva stage, and the tathÄgata stage are all merely provisional designations, in the ten directions and three times they do not come from anywhere, do not go to anywhere, and also do not abide anywhere. Within the stage of lineage up to the tathÄgata stage there are no names, and within names there are no stages of lineage up to the tathÄgata stage. They are neither combined nor separate, but are merely provisionally established.
Why is this?

Because the stage of lineage up to the tathÄgata stage and names are both empty of intrinsic nature, in the emptiness of intrinsic nature, the stage of lineage up to the tathÄgata stage and names are both non-existent and cannot be apprehended.

The name of a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is also like this, only provisionally designated. In the ten directions and three times, it does not come from anywhere, does not go to anywhere, and also does not abide anywhere. Within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, there is no name, and within the name, there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva. It is neither combined nor separate, but only a provisional designation.
Why is it so?

Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva and the name are both empty of inherent nature. Within the emptiness of inherent nature, neither the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva nor the name exist, and both are unobtainable.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason, I say:
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva only has a provisional name.
ÅšÄriputra!

The name of the Å›rÄvaka vehicle is only provisionally designated. In the ten directions and three times, it does not come from anywhere, does not go to anywhere, and also does not abide anywhere. Within the Å›rÄvaka vehicle, there is no name, and within the name, there is no Å›rÄvaka vehicle. It is neither combined nor separate, but only a provisional designation.
Why is it so?
Because the ÅšrÄvaka Vehicle and its name are both empty of intrinsic nature, in intrinsic emptiness the ÅšrÄvaka Vehicle and its name are both non-existent and cannot be apprehended.

Just as the names of the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle and the Great Vehicle are only provisionally designated as guests, they do not come from the ten directions or the three times, do not go anywhere, and also do not abide anywhere. The Pratyekabuddha Vehicle and the Great Vehicle are without names, and names are without the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle and the Great Vehicle. They are neither conjoined nor disjoined, but are only provisionally established.
Why is this?

Because the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle and the Great Vehicle are both empty of intrinsic nature, in intrinsic emptiness the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle and the Great Vehicle are both non-existent and cannot be apprehended.

The name of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is also like this, only provisionally designated as a guest. It does not come from the ten directions or the three times, does not go anywhere, and also does not abide anywhere. The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is without a name, and a name is without the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva. They are neither conjoined nor disjoined, but are only provisionally established.
Why is it so?
Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva and the name are both empty of intrinsic nature. In the emptiness of intrinsic nature, neither the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva nor the name exist and cannot be found.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason, I say:
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is only a provisional name.
At that time, SubhÅ«ti again replied to ÅšÄriputra, saying:
As the Venerable One said, 'Why is it said that like the self, etc. are ultimately unborn?'
ÅšÄriputra!
The self is ultimately completely non-existent, and since it cannot be obtained, how can there be birth?

Sentient beings, living beings, born beings, nourished beings, persons, pudgalas, mind-born, young men, agents, instigators, risers, instigators of rising, receivers, instigators of receiving, knowers, and seers are absolutely and completely nonexistent, and since they cannot be apprehended, how can there be birth?
ÅšÄriputra!
Form is absolutely and completely nonexistent, and since it cannot be apprehended, how can there be birth?
Feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are absolutely and completely nonexistent, and since they cannot be apprehended, how can there be birth?
ÅšÄriputra!
The eye sense base is absolutely and completely nonexistent, and since it cannot be apprehended, how can there be birth?
The ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases are absolutely and completely nonexistent, and since they cannot be apprehended, how can there be birth?
ÅšÄriputra!
The form sense base is absolutely and completely nonexistent, and since it cannot be apprehended, how can there be birth?
The sense fields of sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects are ultimately non-existent, and since they cannot be obtained, how can there be arising?
ÅšÄriputra!
The eye element is ultimately non-existent, and since it cannot be obtained, how can there be arising?

The form element, eye consciousness element, eye contact, and the feelings produced by eye contact as a condition are ultimately non-existent, and since they cannot be obtained, how can there be arising?
ÅšÄriputra!
The ear element is ultimately non-existent, and since it cannot be obtained, how can there be arising?

The sound element, ear consciousness element, ear contact, and the feelings produced by ear contact as a condition are ultimately non-existent, and since they cannot be obtained, how can there be arising?
ÅšÄriputra!
The nose element is ultimately non-existent, and since it cannot be obtained, how can there be arising?

the olfactory sphere, olfactory consciousness, olfactory contact, and the feelings that arise from olfactory contact are ultimately non-existent, and since they cannot be apprehended, how can there be arising?
ÅšÄriputra!
The sphere of the tongue is ultimately non-existent, and since it cannot be apprehended, how can there be arising?
The sphere of tastes, the tongue consciousness, and the feelings that arise from tongue contact are ultimately non-existent, and since they cannot be apprehended, how can there be arising?
ÅšÄriputra!
The sphere of the body is ultimately non-existent, and since it cannot be apprehended, how can there be arising?
The sphere of touches, the body consciousness, and the feelings that arise from body contact are ultimately non-existent, and since they cannot be apprehended, how can there be arising?
ÅšÄriputra!
The sphere of the mind is ultimately non-existent, and since it cannot be apprehended, how can there be arising?

the dharma realm, the mind consciousness realm, and the mind contact, and the feelings produced from the condition of mind contact are absolutely and completely non-existent, and since they cannot be apprehended, how can there be arising?
ÅšÄriputra!
The earth element is absolutely and completely non-existent, and since it cannot be apprehended, how can there be arising?
The water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements are absolutely and completely non-existent, and since they cannot be apprehended, how can there be arising?
ÅšÄriputra!
Ignorance is absolutely and completely non-existent, and since it cannot be apprehended, how can there be arising?

The formative forces, consciousness, name and form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress are absolutely and completely non-existent, and since they cannot be apprehended, how can there be arising?
ÅšÄriputra!
Internal emptiness is absolutely and completely non-existent, and since it cannot be apprehended, how can there be arising?

external emptiness, internal and external emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, emptiness without beginning or end, emptiness of dispersion, emptiness of inherent existence, emptiness of intrinsic nature, emptiness of specific characteristics, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of nature, emptiness of intrinsic nature, emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence are ultimately non-existent, since they cannot be apprehended, how can they arise?
ÅšÄriputra!
The perfection of generosity is ultimately non-existent, since it cannot be apprehended, how can it arise?
The perfections of morality, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom are ultimately non-existent, since they cannot be apprehended, how can they arise?
ÅšÄriputra!
The four meditative concentrations are ultimately non-existent, since they cannot be apprehended, how can they arise?
The four immeasurables and the four formless concentrations are ultimately and totally nonexistent, and since they cannot be obtained, how can they arise?
ÅšÄriputra!
The eight liberations are ultimately and totally nonexistent, and since they cannot be obtained, how can they arise?

The eight superior [meditative] states, the nine successive [meditative] stages, and the ten universal bases are ultimately and totally nonexistent, and since they cannot be obtained, how can they arise?
ÅšÄriputra!
The four establishments of mindfulness are ultimately and totally nonexistent, and since they cannot be obtained, how can they arise?

The four right efforts, the four bases of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of enlightenment, and the eightfold noble path are ultimately and totally nonexistent, and since they cannot be obtained, how can they arise?
ÅšÄriputra!
The gate of liberation through emptiness is ultimately and totally nonexistent, and since it cannot be obtained, how can it arise?
The doors of liberation of signlessness and wishlessness are ultimately completely nonexistent, and since they cannot be obtained, how can they arise?
ÅšÄriputra!
The five eyes are ultimately completely nonexistent, and since they cannot be obtained, how can they arise?
The six supernormal knowledges are ultimately completely nonexistent, and since they cannot be obtained, how can they arise?
ÅšÄriputra!
The ten powers of the Buddha are ultimately completely nonexistent, and since they cannot be obtained, how can they arise?

The four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha are ultimately completely nonexistent, and since they cannot be obtained, how can they arise?
ÅšÄriputra!ğŸ”½Omniscience is ultimately completely nonexistent, and since it cannot be obtained, how can it arise?
The cognition of the pattern of the path and the cognition of all aspects are ultimately completely nonexistent, and since they cannot be obtained, how can they arise?
ÅšÄriputra!
The Dharma of non-forgetfulness is ultimately completely non-existent, and since it cannot be obtained, how can it arise?
The nature of constant abandonment is ultimately completely non-existent, and since it cannot be obtained, how can it arise?
ÅšÄriputra!
All dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways are ultimately completely non-existent, and since they cannot be obtained, how can they arise?
All samÄdhi gateways are ultimately completely non-existent, and since they cannot be obtained, how can they arise?
ÅšÄriputra!
The ground of extreme joy is ultimately completely non-existent, and since it cannot be obtained, how can it arise?

The ground of being free from defilements, the ground of shining, the ground of fiery wisdom, the ground of utmost difficulty to conquer, the ground of manifestation, the ground of going far, the ground of immovability, the ground of excellent wisdom, and the ground of the cloud of Dharma are ultimately completely non-existent, and since they cannot be obtained, how can they arise?
